meanings.definition: To bend or stretch (a part of the body) in order to show strength or suppleness.
meanings.sent1: She decided to flex her arms before the race to warm up.
meanings.sent2: He likes to flex his muscles at the gym to impress others.
meanings.sent3: The yoga instructor asked the class to flex their bodies like rubber bands.
meanings.sent4: The dancer seemed to flex every muscle in her body with grace and precision.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's ability to flex his muscles effortlessly amazed the crowd.

meanings.definition: To exhibit one's power or influence.
meanings.sent1: The CEO likes to flex his authority in the office.
meanings.sent2: She always finds a way to flex her connections to get things done.
meanings.sent3: The superhero decided to flex his superpowers to save the day.
meanings.sent4: The politician tried to flex his influence to sway the decision in his favor.
meanings.sent5: The king would often flex his royal decree to assert his dominance.

meanings.sent1: He tends to flex about his achievements whenever he gets the chance.
meanings.sent2: She likes to flex her knowledge in front of her classmates.
meanings.sent3: The peacock continued to flex its colorful feathers to attract a mate.
meanings.sent4: The actor couldn't resist the urge to flex his acting skills during the audition.
meanings.sent5: The student would flex his academic prowess whenever a new topic was introduced.

meanings.definition: To adjust or adapt to a situation.
meanings.sent1: She had to flex her schedule to accommodate the unexpected meeting.
meanings.sent2: He learned to flex his plans when things didn't go as expected.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to flex the recipe to work with the available ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The team had to flex their strategy to counter the opponent's unexpected move.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to flex the lesson plan to address the students' different learning styles.

meanings.definition: To contract (a muscle) in order to show off.
meanings.sent1: The bodybuilder would flex his biceps to display their size.
meanings.sent2: She would often flex her abs to demonstrate her fitness level.
meanings.sent3: The model would flex his muscles during the photoshoot to highlight his physique.
meanings.sent4: The wrestler would flex his muscles before entering the ring to intimidate his opponent.
meanings.sent5: The athlete would flex his muscles in victory after winning the championship.
